image.altText: A black and white photo of a cemetery overlooking a river.

props.synopsis: After workers dug up two skeletons at a Hobart school's hockey field it was believed there'd likely be more, with the location being an old graveyard. But the scale of what the archaeological team found was staggering — and the job of putting names to the many bones "like a giant puzzle".

title.children: Scandals, decomposed coffins and dodgy records hamper mass exhumation

image.altText: Andrew Barr throws back his head and laughs as he stands in the middle of a semi-circle of colleagues.

props.synopsis: Compared to Tasmania, the ACT seems to have very few elected representatives. But it's debateable whether that's a fair comparison, and whether something should change.

title.children: Debate continues over whether the ACT should have more politicians

image.altText: Two halves of a wooden buoy on a workshop bench.

props.synopsis: Thousands of buoys used for science end up as marine waste — one Tasmanian group is helping to change this. They've created a wooden prototype that can survive the ocean's harshest conditions.

title.children: Wooden buoys developed to aid research while reducing marine waste

image.altText: Paul Bartlett crouching down with a group of labradoodles.

props.synopsis: The RSPCA is investigating if criminal charges are possible for the former owners of Tasmania's largest puppy farm, in the wake of an ABC report that aired concerns from former workers.

title.children: RSPCA takes steps to pursue Tasmanian Labradoodles owners for new charges

image.altText: Hobart bus mall in Elizabeth Street

props.synopsis: Bus drivers at Metro Tasmania will be able to access critical incident leave, which their union says will help drivers cope with ongoing violent and antisocial behaviour.

title.children: Metro bus drivers get critical incident leave after striking

image.altText: A concept image of the proposed Hobart stadium at Macquarie Poi nt.

props.synopsis: The $240 million in Commonwealth funding for the Macquarie Point stadium and precinct will now be exempt from Tasmania's GST calculations, leaving more money for the state and ending a months-long war of words.

title.children: Parties line up to claim credit over federal Hobart stadium funding GST backflip

image.altText: Gregory Geason wearing a blue suit with bus in background

props.synopsis: Former Tasmanian Supreme Court judge Gregory Geason pleaded guilty in a NSW court to one count of contravening a restriction specified in an AVO.

title.children: Former Supreme Court judge sentenced after breaching domestic violence order

image.altText: A helicopter view of Robert Greig's ute on fire in the middle of a forest.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian father says he now accepts police played no role in the death of his fugitive son in 2022 — with an inquest hearing the theory originated with the operator of a Facebook news page.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 Grieving father now accepts cops didn't kill fugitive son

image.altText: Rupert Murdoch looks directly at the camera with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Rupert Murdoch wanted to give son Lachlan future control over his empire by stripping power from his other children. But a court rejected his plan.

title.children: A court ruling has blown up Rupert Murdoch's succession plan

image.altText: Men with pixilated features look at the camera, inside a factory.

props.synopsis: Migrant workers allege exploitation by Kawaguchi Manufacturing, accusing the supplier for Sony, Panasonic and Daikin of not paying wages and withholding passports.

title.children: 'Extremely irresponsible': Sony, Panasonic criticised for exiting amid worker exploitation

image.altText: Two children sit in a red auto rickshaw

props.synopsis: At one of the busiest border crossings in Lebanon, Syrians are bundling up their belongings and preparing for the journey home after the ousting of the Assad regime.

title.children: Syrians line up at the border after years in Lebanon, returning home

image.altText: A hijabi woman in green medical scrubs looks up while standing in front of a ruined house

props.synopsis: Hundreds of doctors, journalists and others are dying in Gaza, international bodies say, alleging they are being targeted by the Israeli military for doing their job.

title.children: Medics, journalists and rescuers are being killed at work in Gaza

image.altText: Two police officers walk on a road, in front of a fire amongst some trees on the roadside

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to Long Swamp Road just outside of Armidale at about 3:30pm on Saturday following reports of a crash.

title.children: Car crashes into group of cyclists, leaving one dead and others injured

image.altText: Two sitting figures are seen in silhouette against the ocean and last light of the setting sun.

props.synopsis: Australians on the front line of climate change are fighting to save their vanishing ancestral home. Can a landmark lawsuit against the federal government save their way of life?

title.children: Life on a sinking island on Australia's northern fringe

image.altText: A young white woman who is blind holding a large straw hat

props.synopsis: Next time you're scrolling for bargains online, consider the half a million Australians who don't find shopping on the web fun or simple, writes Nas Campanella.

title.children: 'Like you don't really matter': Why half a million Aussies struggle with online shopping

image.altText: A man wedged between two woman, all wearing sunglasses while smiling at the camera by the beach

props.synopsis: Kerryn Draper was among hundreds of Australians stranded in Bali after a recent volcanic eruption. She returned with a cautionary tale about the financial and mental pressure of not being able to get home.

title.children: How a long-awaited dream trip to Bali quickly turned sour

image.altText: Composite image of Nathan McSweeney, Mohammed Siraj and Usman Khawaja on day one of the third Test between Australia and India.

props.synopsis: Mohammed Siraj cops boos from the fans, who get their money back as rain restricts day one to just 13 overs, but there was still time for Australia's openers to impress. Here are the quick hits from the first day at the Gabba.

title.children: Five quick hits: Fans take aim at new Indian villain and get a refund for rain-soaked day

image.altText: Tessa Giele, Gretchen Walsh and Alexandria Perkins posing on the podium, holding their medals

props.synopsis: Alex Perkins and Matt Temple grabbed bronze medals for Australia on a record-shattering day, again dominated by US sensation Gretchen Walsh.

title.children: Aussies win medals as American Walsh continues championship domination

image.altText: The back view of a woman with long hair, outside, with pink and green shadows and light around her.

props.synopsis: A leading psychologist says the case involving a woman with dissociative identity disorder gained worldwide attention from those who study and live with multiple personalities.

title.children: 'Relief' as court helps victim give evidence in multiple personalities

image.altText: A lychee farmer holding a bunch of lychees on an orchard.

props.synopsis: From natural disasters to financial ruin, Eddie Cowie's Queensland lychee farm is finally showing signs of life again after nearly a decade of turmoil.

title.children: From fire to fruit, first harvest in years bittersweet for lychee farmers

image.altText: Kevin Andrews outside Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Former federal minister Kevin Andrews has died after a year-long battle with cancer, with the prime minister offering his family a state funeral.

title.children: Former minister and member for Menzies Kevin Andrews dies aged 69

image.altText: A woman in a floral dress in the sun.

props.synopsis: Women, the elderly and other vulnerable residents in Alice Springs say they feel increasingly unsafe after a string of violent incidents, and are taking steps to protect themselves.

title.children: Women, vulnerable residents act to protect themselves amid Alice Springs crime

image.altText: Mikheil Kavelashvili smiles after he was elected the country's new president

props.synopsis: Former Manchester City player Mikheil Kavelashvili becomes president of Georgia, as the ruling party tightened its grip in what the opposition calls a blow to the country's EU aspirations and a victory for former imperial ruler Russia.

title.children: Former soccer striker and critic of the West becomes Georgian president

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: OK, know-it-all … prove just how much you know in this week's Hard Quiz!

title.children: Think you know it all? Only the sharpest minds can ace this quiz!

image.altText: A montage of photos shows people taking pictures or shining lights into penguins burrows

props.synopsis: There are only a very few little penguins left on Granite Island but they're bolder than most and researchers are keen to find out why.

title.children: Scientists explore why penguins on this island are bolder and more aggressive

image.altText: Donald Trump in front of a wall of American flags.

props.synopsis: US president-elect Donald Trump says he will work to end daylight saving time, describing it as an "inconvenient" and unnecessary financial burden on the United States.

title.children: Trump says he will work to 'eliminate daylight saving time' in US

image.altText: Luigi Mangione wears an orange prison suit and is followed by a law enforcement officer.

props.synopsis: Luigi Mangione, the man charged with the murder of a UnitedHealthcare CEO, was not a customer of the health insurer it reveals, as parent company makes its first public comments.

title.children: Health insurer says Luigi Mangione wasn't a client amid copycat arrest

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference in brisbane

props.synopsis: The opposition finally unveiled its much-promised nuclear energy costings on Friday. It will be hoping Labor continues to prove it is not very good at politics.

title.children: There's something spookily familiar about how Dutton handled his nuclear plan

image.altText: A man wearing a cap, silver aviator sunglasses and a tan-coloured hat smiles in a selfie, with white and tan roofs behind him

props.synopsis: A UK coroner has ruled that Daniel Burke died after being shot multiple times while unarmed in Ukraine, with the inquest told an Australian-Algerian dual national had confessed to his death.

title.children: Australian a suspect in 'unlawful killing' of ex-UK soldier in Ukraine

image.altText: A wine glass with swirling red wine against a mountainous dusk backdrop

props.synopsis: Travel by cable car up to alpine vineyards so beautiful Prince wrote a song about them, in a place that keeps the best wines all to itself.

title.children: This country thinks it makes some of the best wine, but won’t let anyone taste it

image.altText: A smiling mum and dad holding their small baby.

props.synopsis: Ocie Ni Dheasmhunaigh has a form of dwarfism so extremely rare, she's one of only three known cases in Australia. The "happy little girl" recently underwent surgery to avoid pain later in life.

title.children: Ocie's rare form of dwarfism was diagnosed soon after her first birthday

image.altText: A man and a woman in formal wear walk through soldiers in gold hats featuring plumes

props.synopsis: The Syrian regime was also one of the world's biggest drug syndicates. What happens to the multi-billion-dollar drug trade now that the "narco-state" has fallen?

title.children: Uncertainty swirls around tiny pill that reanimated Syria's zombie economy

image.altText: Toronto NSW

props.synopsis: An oppressive heatwave stretching from Darwin to Victoria will send temperatures soaring up to 15 degrees Celsius above average during the coming days.

title.children: Hottest summer weather in five years predicted for coming days

image.altText: Ashleigh Gentle crossing finish line at Ironman World Championship in New Zealand.

props.synopsis: Ashleigh Gentle produces a blistering run leg to reach the podium at the Ironman 70.3 World Championship in Taupō, New Zealand.

title.children: Gentle wins bronze for Australia at Ironman world champs

image.altText: A close-up film still of Tommy Dewey, made up like a monster, smiling, his fists resting under his chin.

props.synopsis: After Laura's boyfriend dumps her while she's in hospital recovering from cancer surgery, she finds herself falling for the creature who terrorised her as a child in this bizarre future cult classic.

title.children: Would you date a man or a monster? The lead in this film picks the latter
